byline.contributor: Thomas Erdbrink reported from Tehran, and Clifford Krauss from Houston.
byline.original: By THOMAS ERDBRINK and CLIFFORD KRAUSS

abstract: Iran scrambles to sign oil deals with Western nations in anticipation of Pres-elect Donald J Trump's hard-line policies; Iranian Pres Hassan Rouhani, who was elected on promise to reverse damage done to country's economy after years of recently-lifted Obama administration sanctions, also hopes to gain ground on regional rival and fellow OPEC member Saudia Arabia.
lead_paragraph: Worried about the American president-elect’s rhetoric, Tehran has signed a wave of agreements since Nov. 8 with European and Asian energy companies.
snippet: Worried about the American president-elect’s rhetoric, Tehran has signed a wave of agreements since Nov. 8 with European and Asian energy companies....

headline.main: Iran Races to Clinch Oil Deals Before Donald Trump Takes Office
headline.print_headline: Iran Races for Oil Deals Before Trump Takes Office
